greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of proper divisors of the form 3k+1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} x^(6*k-4) / (1 - x^(3*k-2)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 14 2021
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, 1 &, And[Mod[#, 3] == 1, # != n] &], {n, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 08 2017 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 06 2017
